results.abstract: A year ago, the investigation into the former president appeared from the outside to be over. But a series of crucial turning points led to this week’s indictment.

results.byline: By Penelope Colston and Jake Michaels
results.title: The Finnish Secret to Happiness? Knowing When You Have Enough.
results.abstract: The Nordic nation has been ranked the happiest country on earth for six consecutive years. But when you talk to individual Finns, the reality is a bit more complicated.

media.caption: Henna and Niklas Hukari, siblings who play badminton in the rural community of Toholampi, are among more than a dozen Finns we spoke with about how optimism manifests in their lives.

results.adx_keywords: Health Clubs;Luxury Goods and Services;Exercise;internal-sub-only;United States
results.title: Think Getting Into College Is Hard? Try Applying for These Gyms.
results.abstract: A new crop of luxury, application-only gyms requires referrals, interviews, deep dives through your social media and even, in some cases, medical evaluations. And that’s before paying a monthly fee of up to $2,750.

media.caption: Ghost, a gym in Williamsburg, is part of a new crop of luxury fitness centers requiring an extensive application process. “If you’re making widgets in Akron, Ohio, they may not want you,” said the founder of another gym.

results.adx_keywords: Movies;War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity;Colonization;Kraume, Lars (1973- );Jazama, Girley;Germany;Namibia
results.title: A Movie Confronts Germany’s Other Genocide
results.abstract: “Measures of Men” tells the story of the systematic massacre of Herero and Nama people in what is now Namibia. Its maker hopes the film will bring a debate about Germany’s colonial guilt into the center of society.
des_facet: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media.caption: Leonard Scheicher, left, and Girley Jazama in “Measures of Men,” which tells the story of the Herero and Nama genocide in what now Namibia through the eyes of a German anthropologist.

results.adx_keywords: Interior Design and Furnishings;Home Repairs and Improvements;Windows;Content Type: Service
results.title: Why You Need Window Blinds (Even if You Don’t Think So)
results.abstract: Designers consider window shades and blinds essential for many reasons. But there are so many options — how do you choose the right ones?

media.caption: Window shades and blinds help put a finishing touch on any room. In this Harlem dining room, Sheila Bridges, the New York designer, used two layers of shades — a flat Roman shade with a translucent roller shade behind it — to control light levels.

results.title: Knitters Say Stitching Helps Them Follow the Thread in Meetings
results.abstract: An official in Wales was called out for knitting in a virtual meeting, setting off a debate over etiquette. Experts say the fine-motor movement activates the parts of the brain used for focus.

media.caption: Rachel Garrick, a county councilor in Wales, was criticized for knitting during a virtual public meeting in January. Ms. Garrick and other knitters say the craft helps them focus.
media.copyright: Andrew Testa for The New York Times

results.abstract: Investors in the S&P 500 are highly dependent on the fate of Microsoft, Apple and other big technology stocks. A rally in March showed how this can mask turmoil in the rest of the market.
